intro: Juncus balticus f. dissitiflorus, commonly known as the Baltic rush, is a flowering plant characterized by its dense, cylindrical spikes of small, greenish-white flowers. It is a member of the Juncaceae family and typically grows in moist to wet environments such as marshes and stream banks. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves that are often丛生 (clumped) at the base, forming a compact rosette. Its inflorescence consists of numerous sessile or short-stemmed flowers arranged in two distinct rows. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in wetland gardens.
